comments.body: I don't know if this new comment adds a lot of value
Do any managed fields updaters return a nil new object?
That's a good question. We just merged a [PR](https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/structured-merge-diff/pull/158) so that we return a `nil` new object when the object hasn't changed ...

I have a little concern about this: `atMostEverySecond` called twice:
If first `atMostEverySecond` is satisfied with ` time.Since(s.lastCall) >= s.delay` so it exec klog message and update the `s.lastCall` which will never let the second `atMostEverySecond` satisfy `time.Since(s.lastCall) >= s.delay`. I don't know if this logic is intended to do.
That's exactly what's intended? We don't want the content of the function (the `klog.Errorf`) to be executed more than once per second (and just by-pass/skip it otherwise).

If the first atMostEverySecond.Do was called, then the function would have returned anyway, since the next line is "return newObj, managed, nil", so there's no way both of these atMostEverySecond.Do calls would happen for a single request.
You're not doing anything with `err`, can you either panic, return or ignore altogether (`_`)?
